item.title: Storm Ida: New York declares state of emergency over 'brutal flooding'
item.description: The mayor says the city is "enduring an historic weather event" as New Jersey also declares an emergency.

item.title: Texas abortion law: Supreme Court votes not to block ban
item.description: The court said legal challenges to the law banning abortions for most women could still proceed.

item.title: Texas abortion law: What women make of six-week abortion ban
item.description: Anti-abortion activists celebrate but a doctor who could be targeted by new law fears for the future.

item.title: Afghanistan crisis: Unclear if ruthless Taliban will change, says US general
item.description: General Mark Milley says it "remains to be seen" whether the Islamist group will change.

item.title: Dontae Sharpe: 'My 26-year fight to prove my innocence'
item.description: After two decades wrongfully behind bars, Dontae Sharpe is finally free but there's one more battle to fight.

item.title: Joe Rogan: Popular US podcast host says he has Covid-19 but is 'feeling great'
item.description: He caused controversy in April when he suggested young, healthy people did not need the vaccine.

item.title: Syed Ali Geelani: Kashmir's separatist leader dies aged 92
item.description: Syed Ali Geelani, a staunch critic of India, was under house arrest for much of the last decade.

item.title: Afghanistan: Facebook says it helped people flee, including staff
item.description: The flight arrived in Mexico City on Wednesday, with 175 Afghan citizens on board, including 75 children.

item.title: Mr Zelensky (finally) goes to Washington
item.description: The Ukrainian president pressed by Donald Trump gets his White House visit - and a new set of worries.

item.title: China steps in to regulate brutal '996' work culture
item.description: Workers in China are fed up with the brutal 12-hour work days once seen as a key driver of success.

item.title: Sackler family wins immunity from further opioid litigation
item.description: A US judge has approved a bankruptcy plan for the maker of OxyContin painkillers.

item.title: Viewpoint: Algerian blame games expose deep political crisis
item.description: Algerians are clamouring for democratic reforms and the weakening the influence of the military.

item.title: Afghanistan: Qatar and Turkey become Taliban's lifeline to the outside world
item.description: Qatar and Turkey emerge as key channels between Afghanistan's new rulers and the outside world.

item.title: Inger Stoejberg: Danish ex-immigration minister faces impeachment trial
item.description: Inger Stoejberg is accused of unlawfully ordering the separation of young asylum-seeking couples.

item.title: Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards 2021 finalists revealed
item.description: An angry starling and a lounging bear were also among the competition finalists.

item.title: Beaten and humiliated by Hindu mobs for being a Muslim in India
item.description: Attacks on Muslims by Hindu mobs have risen in India, with little apparent official condemnation.

item.title: Kabul make-up artist: 'Women like me are Taliban targets'
item.description: A make-up artist in hiding explains how much Afghanistan's beauty industry has meant to women.

item.title: New York City declares state of emergency after record rainfall
item.description: NYC Mayor Bill de Blasio said the city was "enduring an historic weather event".

item.title: Spain hit with severe flooding after storm
item.description: Homes in north and central Spain are left isolated and without electricity as roads are forced to close.

item.title: Paralympics: How hand-cycling saved my life
item.description: In preparation for the Paralympics, South Korean hand-cycling champion, Doyeon Lee has been riding more than 300km every week.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban parade captured equipment in Kandahar
item.description: The militant group showcased the kit captured during their takeover of Afghanistan.

item.title: Former Afghan minister: Women fearful but walking the streets
item.description: Former Afghan finance minister Omar Zakhilwal says there is no alternative to working with the Taliban.

item.title: Afghanistan women's cricket team: Players hiding in Kabul fear Taliban rule
item.description: Members of Afghanistan's women's cricket team are hiding in Kabul, fearing for their safety following the Taliban's return to power.

item.title: Afghanistan: British passport delay blamed for baby stranded in Kabul
item.description: "We want to hug her, kiss her", say her parents, who had to return to the UK to replace travel documents.

item.title: Female journalist who interviewed Taliban flees
item.description: Beheshta Arghand, who made headlines when she interviewed the Taliban, has spoken out after fleeing the country.

item.title: Afghanistan: Joe Biden speech on withdrawal fact-checked
item.description: How consistent is President Biden in his comments on Afghanistan following the final US troop withdrawal?

item.title: Afghanistan: Rescued animals 'in amazing condition' in UK
item.description: Most of the 150 animals rescued by "Pen" Farthing's charity are to be adopted by veterans.
